title: Murzin Wins Rapid World Championship, Humpy Earns 2nd Title In Women's - Chess.com
summary:
Murzin Wins Rapid World Championship, Humpy Earns 2nd Title In Women's

Date: December 29, 2024
Source: Chess.com

GM Volodar Murzin made history by winning the 2024 FIDE World Rapid Chess Championship with an undefeated score of 10/13, becoming the second-youngest champion at just 18. Meanwhile, GM Koneru Humpy made a remarkable comeback to win the 2024 FIDE Women's World Rapid Chess Championship with 8.5/11, securing her second world title.

  • Murzin was the 59th seed but finished first.
  • Humpy's victory came after a challenging year.
  • Both championships saw a significant turnout, highlighting the growing popularity of chess.
  • Upcoming events include the FIDE World Blitz Chess Championship.
"I hope this is not a dream. I don't know what to say. I am really happy." - Volodar Murzin

Both players received substantial prizes for their achievements, with Murzin earning $90,000 and Humpy taking home $60,000.
newTitle: Murzin and Humpy Triumph at the 2024 FIDE Rapid Chess Championships

title: Sources: Lakers' Russell to Nets in 4-player trade - ESPN India
summary:
Lakers Trading D'Angelo Russell to Nets in 4-Player Deal

Date: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: ESPN

The Los Angeles Lakers have agreed to trade D'Angelo Russell, Maxwell Lewis, and three second-round picks to the Brooklyn Nets for Dorian Finney-Smith and Shake Milton. This significant move reshapes both teams as they navigate the ongoing NBA season.

  • The Lakers acquire Dorian Finney-Smith, known for his perimeter defense and 3-point shooting.
  • Russell returns to the Nets, where he previously had success, including an All-Star selection.
  • This trade gives the Lakers financial flexibility, saving $15 million in salary expenses.
  • The Nets enhance their draft assets, now holding a total of 31 draft picks over the next seven years.
“Surprise, surprise,” Russell said, reflecting on his unexpected return to LA after prior trade talks.

This trade is seen as a strategic move for both franchises, aiming to bolster their chances for the ongoing season and future prospects.
newTitle: Lakers Trade D'Angelo Russell to Nets in Major Deal

title: Sunil Gavaskar clarifies context of 'stupid' remark for Rishabh Pant - The Times of India
summary:
Sunil Gavaskar clarifies context of 'stupid' remark for Rishabh Pant

Publication Date: Saturday

Source: Times of India

Legendary cricketer Sunil Gavaskar expressed his disapproval of Rishabh Pant's shot selection, calling it 'stupid'. He criticized Pant for prioritizing ego over strategy during a critical moment in the Boxing Day Test.

  • Gavaskar was upset with Pant's risky ramp shot during the match.
  • He suggested the shot was a result of ego rather than situational awareness.
  • Gavaskar expressed concerns about Pant trying to assert dominance instead of playing strategically.
  • He acknowledged Pant's talent but questioned the need for such a high-risk shot.
  • Gavaskar emphasized the importance of playing conventional cricketing strokes for success.
“When I see somebody as talented as Rishabh Pant play that shot, I had no problem with the first shot he played and missed. The reason I got upset was that ego took over for the next ball.”

In conclusion, Gavaskar advocates for Pant to rely on his conventional skills rather than taking unnecessary risks in crucial matches.
newTitle: Sunil Gavaskar clarifies context of 'stupid' remark for Rishabh Pant

title: What is highest successful run-chase at Melbourne Cricket Ground in Tests? - Business Standard
summary:
India Set to Chase Record at MCG in 4th Test Against Australia

Publication Date: Date Not Specified | Source: Business Standard

As India gears up to chase a challenging target of 334 runs against Australia in the ongoing 4th Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG), this match could see the highest successful run chase in Test history at this iconic venue.

  • India requires 334 runs to win after Australia opted not to declare their second innings.
  • Mohammed Siraj took a crucial wicket of Marnus Labuschagne, balancing the game in India's favor briefly.
  • Australia’s tail-enders boosted their second-innings total, pushing their lead to 333 runs by Day 4's end.
  • India's Jasprit Bumrah had a missed opportunity to dismiss Nathan Lyon due to a no-ball call, which could affect the outcome.
“Will Australia press on further with their innings or declare overnight? Day 5 promises high drama and a thrilling finish.”

Historically, England holds the record for the highest successful run chase at the MCG with 332 runs against Australia in 1928, a record that remains unbeaten.
newTitle: India Set to Chase Record at MCG in 4th Test Against Australia

title: "Their places are being questioned": Sunil Gavaskar names two Indian players who could be dropped from the fifth Test - Crictoday
summary:

In the context of the ongoing five-Test series against Australia, Sunil Gavaskar has pointed out that significant changes may be needed in the Indian bowling lineup. With the captain Rohit Sharma facing challenges due to underperforming bowlers, the management might consider dropping Mohammed Siraj and Akash Deep for the Sydney Test.

  • Jasprit Bumrah has been the standout performer, taking 29 wickets in the series.
  • Sunil Gavaskar believes Siraj and Akash Deep could be replaced to improve team performance.
  • Sanjay Manjrekar has echoed Gavaskar's sentiment about Siraj being under scrutiny.
“Their (Mohammed Siraj and Akash Deep) places are being questioned. They haven’t been good with the ball, and it has impacted the team’s performance.” - Sunil Gavaskar

Given the critical observation of the players' performances, it is likely that the Indian team will make adjustments to find a winning combination in the upcoming matches.

PKL 2024 Finals HIGHLIGHTS: Haryana Steelers beat Patna Pirates to win their maiden PKL title - Business Standard
summary:
PKL 2024 Finals HIGHLIGHTS: Haryana Steelers beat Patna Pirates to win their maiden PKL title

Published on: December 29, 2024 | Source: Business Standard

The Pro Kabaddi League 2024 concluded with Haryana Steelers defeating Patna Pirates by 9 points, securing their first-ever championship title.

  • Haryana Steelers overcame last season's disappointment as runners-up.
  • This marks the fourth instance in PKL history where a team won the title after being a runner-up the previous season.
  • Patna Pirates were unable to relive their past success of winning from the eliminators.
  • The match ended with a score of 32-23 in favor of Haryana Steelers.
  • Notable player performances included Devank Dalal leading in raid points, and Mohammadreza Shadloui as the top defender.
“Haryana Steelers are now the eighth team in PKL history to win the trophy.”

This victory signifies a remarkable turnaround for the Haryana Steelers, illustrating their growth and resilience in the league.
newTitle: Haryana Steelers Claim Maiden PKL Title, Defeating Patna Pirates

title: What is Nitish Kumar Reddy's IPL earnings? SRH owner Kavya Maran raised his salary 25 times in just one year - India.com
summary:
Nitish Kumar Reddy's IPL Earnings Soar 25 Times in a Year

Publication Date: Not specified Source: India.com

Nitish Kumar Reddy, after an impressive performance in the IPL, has seen a significant raise in his salary, which has increased 25 times within a year, from Rs 20 lakh to Rs 6 crore.

  • Nitish Kumar Reddy debuted in IPL 2023 but gained recognition in 2024.
  • Reddy scored 303 runs with a strike rate of 143 in the 2024 season, including 2 half-centuries.
  • His salary was raised by Kavya Maran, the owner of Sunrisers Hyderabad.
  • He played a critical role in leading his team to the IPL final.
  • Nitish Reddy has been retained for IPL 2025 for Rs 6 crore.
“Nitish earned Rs 20 lakh in 2023, he is set to make Rs 6 crore in the 2025 IPL.”

This remarkable raise underscores the impact of Reddy's performance on his team's success and the IPL's growing financial dynamics.

title: WTC final scenarios: South Africa through, but what about India, Australia and Sri Lanka? - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
WTC Final Scenarios: South Africa Qualified, India's, Australia's, and Sri Lanka's Paths

Publication Date: Not specified Source: ESPNcricinfo

South Africa's thrilling two-wicket victory over Pakistan has secured their spot in the World Test Championship (WTC) final, leaving one slot open for India, Australia, and Sri Lanka. The article explores the qualifying scenarios for these three teams.

Key Points:

  • South Africa has confirmed their place in the WTC final with a win over Pakistan.
  • India must win both remaining Tests against Australia to ensure qualification.
  • Australia can qualify with wins over India, regardless of their performances against Sri Lanka.
  • Sri Lanka needs to sweep Australia and rely on outcomes from the India vs Australia Tests.
“If India win one Test and draw the other, they'll finish on 57.02.”

Conclusion: The upcoming matches are crucial for India, Australia, and Sri Lanka as they vie for the last spot in the WTC final, contingent on various match outcomes.

  • Sikandar Raza (Zimbabwe): Matches: 24, Runs: 573, Wickets: 24

title: ‘Bumrah is head and shoulders above Marshall, Garner, Ambrose’: Gilchrist drops huge West Indies' greats comparison - Hindustan Times
summary:
‘Bumrah is head and shoulders above Marshall, Garner, Ambrose’: Gilchrist drops huge West Indies' greats comparison

Date: Dec 29, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Adam Gilchrist praised Jasprit Bumrah, stating he is superior to legendary West Indies bowlers Marion Marshall, Joel Garner, and Curtly Ambrose, following Bumrah's impressive performance in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Bumrah has been a standout performer in the current series, taking 29 wickets.
  • He achieved his 200th Test wicket during the match against Australia.
  • Gilchrist referred to Bumrah as 'a world-class performer' and emphasized the uniqueness of his skills.
  • Bumrah's bowling average of 19.52 is lower than that of legendary bowlers Marshall, Garner, and Ambrose.
  • The current Test match sees Australia leading with a significant margin, but Bumrah aims to wrap up their innings.
“He is head and shoulders above,” said Gilchrist, highlighting Bumrah's dominance in comparison to West Indies greats.

Gilchrist's remarks underscore Bumrah's exceptional talent as India looks to capitalize on his skills to turn the match in their favor.
newTitle: Gilchrist Compares Bumrah to West Indies Legends

title: Koneru Humpy: From mulling retirement to a second world rapid crown - Hindustan Times
summary:
Koneru Humpy Triumphs Again: From Retirement Doubts to a Second World Rapid Championship

Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Koneru Humpy has made a remarkable comeback in chess, winning her second Women's World Rapid title against all odds at the age of 37. This victory marks her as one of the only players to win this title twice.

  • She previously took a break from competitive chess following complications from pregnancy and motherhood.
  • In the 2019 championship, she claimed her first title through tie-breaks.
  • This time, she won outright without needing tiebreakers, finishing first with a score of 8.5/11 points.
  • Humpy faced doubts about her performance leading up to the tournament but turned her struggles into a title-winning performance.
  • She believes her success will inspire younger players in India to pursue chess professionally.
“This victory is very special. I was feeling low and this win gives me the boost to fight and to work on chess again.” - Koneru Humpy

Humpy’s journey emphasizes overcoming personal and professional hurdles to achieve success, showcasing her dedication to chess and her family.
newTitle: Koneru Humpy Triumphs Again: From Retirement Doubts to a Second World Rapid Championship
